title: How to Make an Upside Down Man Costume

steps.headline: Buy a pair of large pants, big enough that you can pull them down over your head to your belly-button and fit a head and arm in one leg.
steps.description: Don't buy brand new pants unless you want to, try looking in thrift stores or ask a bigger friend if they have any pants you can have.

steps.headline: Make two small slits in the pants, one for your eyes and one for your mouth.
Tape a tie (must be a real tie, no clip-ons) to a big long-sleeve shirt (button-up works best).
steps.description: You can use duct tape, but any thing that can hold the tie when the shirt is upside-down works. Consider safety pins.

steps.headline: Get a mannequin head.
steps.description: You can find them at most Halloween stores (they're usually where the masks are) and they don't cost much.

steps.headline: Secure the mannequin head in the shirt by tightening the tie around its neck.
Duct tape a pair of gloves to your shoes and get a pair of shoes for your hands.
Start with the shirt.
steps.description: With the buttons (front) facing forward, slowly pull it up with your legs in the sleeves.

steps.headline: Put your shoes (the ones with the gloves) on your feet.
Put on the pants, with a head and an arm in one leg and your other arm in the other leg (make sure that the eye and mouth holes are in the right places).
Go to the mirror to check out the costume to make sure you put it on correctly.

tyn: Someone to help you carry your candy (you have no hands)
text: Buy a pair of large pants, big enough that you can pull them down over your head to your belly-button and fit a head and arm in one leg. Don't buy brand new pants unless you want to, try looking in thrift stores or ask a bigger friend if they have any pants you can have. Make two small slits in the pants, one for your eyes and one for your mouth.  Tape a tie (must be a real tie, no clip-ons) to a big long-sleeve shirt (button-up works best). You can use duct tape, but any thing that can hold the tie when the shirt is upside-down works. Consider safety pins. Get a mannequin head. You can find them at most Halloween stores (they're usually where the masks are) and they don't cost much. Secure the mannequin head in the shirt by tightening the tie around its neck.  Duct tape a pair of gloves to your shoes and get a pair of shoes for your hands.  Put on the costume!  Start with the shirt. With the buttons (front) facing forward, slowly pull it up with your legs in the sleeves. Put your shoes (the ones with the gloves) on your feet.  Put on the pants, with a head and an arm in one leg and your other arm in the other leg (make sure that the eye and mouth holes are in the right places).  Go to the mirror to check out the costume to make sure you put it on correctly.
